member.name: IKsJackDescription2.GetJackCount
member.summary: The GetJackCount method gets the number of jacks on the connector, which are required to connect to an endpoint device.
member.param: Receives the number of audio jacks associated with the connector.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

member.name: IKsJackDescription2.GetJackDescription2
member.summary: The GetJackDescription2 method gets the description of a specified audio jack.
member.param: The index of the jack to get a description for. If the connection consists of n jacks, the jacks are numbered from 0 to n– 1. To get the number of jacks, call the method.
Pointer to a caller-allocated buffer into which the method writes a structure of type that contains information about the jack. The buffer size must be at least sizeof(KSJACK_DESCRIPTION2).

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

listheader.description: Parameter nJack is not a valid jack index.

summary.para: The IKsJackDescription2 interface provides information about the jacks or internal connectors that provide a physical connection between a device on an audio adapter and an external or internal endpoint device (for example, a microphone or CD player).

In addition to getting jack information such as type of connection, the is primarily used to report whether the jack was connected to the device. In Windows 7, if the connected device driver supports IKsJackDescription2, the audio stack or an application can use this interface to get information additional jack information. This includes the jack's detection capability and if the format of the device has changed dynamically.

Most Windows audio adapter drivers support the Windows Driver Model (WDM) and use kernel-streaming (KS) properties to represent the hardware description parameters in connectors (referred to as KS pins). The IKsJackDescription2 interface provides convenient access to the KSPROPERTY_JACK_DESCRIPTION2 property of a connector to an endpoint device. For more information about KS properties and KS pins, see the Windows DDK documentation.

An application obtains a reference to the IKsJackDescription2 interface of a part by calling the method with parameter refiid set to REFIIDIID_IKsJackDescription2. The call to IPart.Activate succeeds only if the part supports the IKsJackDescription2 interface. Only a part object that represents a bridge pin connector on a KS filter device topology object supports this interface.
